abstract: Johnson & Johnson faces a wave of lawsuits from patients who say they were injured when all-metal implants sold by the company failed.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson faces a wave of lawsuits from patients who say they were injured when all-metal implants sold by the company failed.
lead_paragraph: The orthopedic unit of Johnson & Johnson said Thursday that it was phasing out production of all-metal replacement hips, a move reflecting an industrywide trend to abandon the once widely used implants because of high early failure rates.

headline.main: J.&J. Unit Phasing Out All-Metal Hip Devices
headline.print_headline: J.&J. Unit Phasing Out All-Metal Hip Devices
